food:en: flying insects, such as moths, butterflies, damselflies, craneflies,other tasty morsels. if the weather is bad, they can search trees,shrubs for other insect food.

food:en: vegetation, the leaves,stems of grasses, roots,seeds.
name: Branta leucopsis

food:en: seeds in winter; insects in summer.
name: Fringilla montifringilla

food:en: white-tailed eagles are versatile,opportunistic hunters,carrion feeders, sometimes pirating food from other birds,even otters. they eat largely fish, but also take various birds, rabbits,hares.some pairs kill many fulmars, which are thought to be the source of ddt,pcbs (chemicals) recorded in eagle eggs. carrion is an important part of their diet, especially during the winter months. most lambs are taken as carrion.when fishing, they fly low over water, stop to hover for a moment,drop to snatch fish from the surface.during the breeding season while they are rearing young, they require 500-600g of food per day. this drops to 200-300g per day during the winter months when the birds are less active.
name: Haliaeetus albicilla

food:en: omnivore - scavenges a wide range of food.
name: Larus fuscus
